EXTRACTED VALUE: To sum this up, this game is your standard scrolling shooter, it's nothing special and nothing majorly appalling.
It's just run-of-the-mill game design. Bar the occasionally impressive combat, Beowulf doesn't have enough to make it stand out.
This not a good game. It's not an outright right failure either, but with limited gaming funds and time I suggest giving this title a wide berth.
War has rarely been this uninspiring and run-of-the-mill.
If you've already played the Xbox version there is absolutely no reason to play this version other than to add gamerpoints to your pile.
There's so little to the game that it's hard to imagine it holding anyone's interest for long.
There are three great hours here of simple underwater fish munching fun. [Issue #16, p.77]
The actual racing is sluggish and generally skill-free, but the mini games are top fun. [Sept 2007, p.96]
There really is not much to TiQal. If you play the demo for five minutes, you've pretty much mastered all there is to the game.
I'm sorry to say, four million Japanese can be wrong. [Nov 2001, p.122]
It's certainly a graphical step down from the usual PSX fare - for that matter it's a graphical step down from the NES.
Save for its fish tank presentation, this is a wholly unremarkable version of Tetris.
Tetris Evolution should have been a $10 Xbox Live download.
